original_text: as written by michael berg and michael j . wilson from a story by wilson , this relentless , all-wise-guys-all-the-time approach tries way too hard and gets tiring in no time at all .
generated_text:
1. "This over-the-top, all-action-all-the-time approach tries way too hard and gets exhausting in no time."
2. "The relentless, all-smart-people-all-the-time approach falls flat and becomes tedious quickly."
3. "This all-knowing, all-powerful approach tries too hard to impress and gets old fast."
4. "The all-angsty, all-the-time approach tries too hard to be edgy and gets tiresome quickly."
